verbose_text: Since it has been shown that the cleavage stage may not be the best approach to identify aneuploidy reliably because of the high incidence of chromosomal mosaicism, the European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology (ESHRE) Task Force on PGS decided to initiate a pilot study of polar body (PB) biopsy and chromosome copy number analysis using array comparative genomic hybridization (CGH) to analyse the chromosome complement in both the first (PB1) and second (PB2) polar bodies.
evidence: Task Force on PGS decided to initiate a pilot
